item.title: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds Launch Roster Appears Online
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/sonic-racing-crossworlds-launch-roster-appears-online/

After getting a new trailer during PlayStation State of Play on Wednesday, the launch roster for Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds has made its way online.

As first spotted by Sonic Stadium, the Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds roster briefly appeared online before it was removed. The game will launch with 23 characters from the series’ history, including:

  • Sonic
  • Knuckles
  • Tails
  • Shadow
  • Amy
  • Eggman/Robotnik
  • Metal Sonic
  • Jet
  • Wave
  • Storm
  • Rouge
  • E-123 Omega
  • Vector
  • Charmy
  • Espio
  • Blaze
  • Silver
  • Cream
  • Zavok
  • Zazz
  • Big
  • Egg Pawn
  • Sage

Most, if not all, of the roster can be seen in the trailer that was released. But the 23 racers won’t be the only ones available for players. According to the game’s website—again, it was removed after likely appearing early—Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds will see “a ton more” drivers added to the game from across Sega’s different franchises.

There will also be 24 “main tracks” with 15 CrossWorlds that require Travel Rings to go to. Players will have 45 “unique original vehicles” to choose from for their races with 23 different power ups available to help you win the race.

A release date for Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds hasn’t been announced, but when it releases, the game will be available for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, Switch, and PC.

A closed network test is currently scheduled for February 21-23.

What do you think of the launch roster and details for Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

item.title: Embracer CEO Says “Teams Need To Have The Resources” To Make Games After Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Success
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/embracer-ceo-says-teams-need-to-have-the-resources-to-make-games-after-kingdom-come-deliverance-2-success/

Embracer held its Q3 FY2025 earnings call on Thursday, and with it came high praise from CEO Lars Wingefors for the recently released Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2. As part of his prepared remarks for the call, Wingefors said that the game’s launch success is a “reminder” to the company about creating “great products”.

“The success of Kingdom Come: Deliverance II is a reminder of our core – to bring great products to the market,” the Embracer CEO said. “High-quality teams need to have the resources and the time to execute their visions.

“When you have right teams, this trust benefits everyone, including gamers, employees and shareholders. I am convinced that we will remain among the industry leaders in our core business verticals in the future.”

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is one of the more successful titles from Embracer in recent memory. The game sold over a million copies in its first day, and, according to the publisher, is “fast approaching 2 million”.

Developer Warhorse Studios recently announced its post-launch plans for the game, including free updates such as horse racing and hardcore mode. There are also three planned expansions coming to the game over the next year. Lastly, official mod support was confirmed as coming in the near future.

In Insider Gaming’s official review, Grant Taylor-Hill called Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 a “masterpiece” that was tough to “find one major fault” with.

“Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is beautiful in every aspect,” he wrote. “It’s deeply authentic and riddled with emotion and catharsis, and the way the story comes together is just perfection.”

What do you make of Wingefors comments on giving studios resources to make great games? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what feature FromSoftware is considering adding to Elden Ring Nightreign down the line. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter

item.title: Astro Bot Announces 5 New Free Levels and Special Bots
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/astro-bot-announces-5-new-levels-and-special-bots/

Team Asobi has announced five new levels for Astro Bot. One will be released today, and the rest will appear weekly until March 13, 2025. 

Astro Bot’s five new levels will be a free update, arriving as a gift to the community from Team Asobi. The first level, Tick-Tock Shock, was an unreleased level only featured during the PlayStation XP Tournament Final in London, England, last month. Players can finally check out this exclusive level and the other four new ones through the brand-new Vicious Void Galaxy. Each of them will provide a new Special bot. Check out the schedule for the upcoming Astro Bot levels below: 

  • Tick-Tock Shock: February 13
  • Thrust or Bust: February 20
  • Cock-A-Doodle-Doom: February 27
  • Hard to Bear: March 6
  • Armored Hardcore: March 13

Team Asobi has informed players that Astro Bot’s new update will feature more challenging levels than the Winter Wonder update and will test their skills further. Once completed, the new levels can be replayed through the Time Attack Mode with online rankings. However, players must complete the main game to access the latest content. All new levels will be available every Thursday at 6:00 am PT, 2:00 pm GMT, and 10:00 pm JST. 

Moreover, Astro Bot will also receive new PS5 Pro support along with the new levels. Players on the mid-gen refresh console will experience an enhanced version of Astro Bot that features “constant best resolution while still running at 60 frames per second.”

In other news, Astro Bot was also the Insider Gaming Community’s Game of the Year. What are your thoughts on Astro Bot’s upcoming levels? Let us know in the comments or on our new community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Nintendo acquiring a new anti-Palworld patent. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
